I have log4j in my classpath and have it configured for minimal 
logging.  However whenever I run my SpringFramework test harness for 
Controller which uses Hibernate I get pages of logging.  It doesn't 
appear to be using my log4j.properties that I have in my classpath.  
Is there a default one that is overriding mine, or is there something 
special to determine which it is using?  I have tried everything to 
make this work, am I missing something obvious?  The Unit tests pick 
up all my other property files for use by the objects in the test, 
but the logging is very verbose.

example:  [very truncated]

...


   [junit] - Creating shared instance of singleton 
bean 'localeResolver'

bean 'themeResolver'
